conclusion: Principles of shadow formation: position depends on relative positions of light source and objects.
Principles of shadow formation: size influenced by distance between object and shadow plane.
Initial position of shadow A (Cake): large due to shape and light angle.
Effect of light source moving forward on shadow A: shadow area expands horizontally.
Initial position of shadow B (Cardboard Box): smaller compared to cake but significant.
Effect of light source moving forward on shadow B: shadow becomes larger.
Initial position of shadow C (Carton): positioned below and to the left of the carton.
Effect of light source moving forward on shadow C: shadow area becomes larger.
Initial position of shadow D (Baseball): round and located to the right of the ball.
Effect of light source moving forward on shadow D: shadow area expands outward and downward.
Final answer: all shadows will move backward and increase in size.
